reddit title: Why has South Station absolutely REEKED lately?
reddit body:
In recent weeks, it has smelled horrible at South Station -- almost like wet
trash that has been sitting out in the sun. It is so unbelievably strong and
unavoidable.   So what is it that I'm smelling? Why is the station generally
such a disappointment lol

reddit body:
I've seen people complain about the smell of North Station, but nothing compares
to Courthouse from my experience.  This station uniquely always has a rancid
smell like that of vomit. It's horrible and I'm wondering if anyone has any
guesses why it does. I know there's issues to do with water leaking in the
station, maybe it has something to do with that?

reddit body:
Barely any rush hour service, very infrequent off peak service, 2-3 trains
stopping at Silver Hill on weekdays only, and 2+ hour gaps aren't doing anyone
any good here! On top of that, this line is terrible with on time performance.
Whoever wrote out this schedule did a pretty bad job at it. Why does this exist
if the majority of the line is double tracked and the neighborhoods it serves
are quite dense???

next train is supposed to be an hour later but was a half an hour later than

reddit body:
Anybody else notice an uptick in delays this fall?  Yesterday morning, the train
was almost an hour late.  Yesterday afternoon, the engine had a problem and we
had to switch trains.  This morning, something is wrong with the engine AGAIN,
and we have been at a standstill for 15 minutes with no update and no end in
sight.  These issues don‚Äôt seem all event related (like a storm / downed trees).
Is there some reason why it‚Äôs gotten so bad lately?  The Fitchburg line used to
be reliable‚Ä¶

reddit body:

exactly from whom/where, because I was ready to ask to turn it down. I
eventually moved to another car, where someone else was listening to another
kind of music. There is no winning unless you‚Äôre an asshole, which seems to be
very trendy lately.

reddit body:
Bus drivers must get so annoyed when passengers stand right at the front talking
to them for miles and miles. It seems like a big distraction, first of all. It
also just seems so irritating. Most of the time drivers aren't responding
anyway, and people keep talking even when the plexiglass barrier is closed.
Sometimes it seems like they might actually know each other, or maybe the driver
is just chatty, but I just feel bad for them!

reddit title: Lowell Line - What is going on with the service lately?
reddit body:
The last few weeks it seems like in an inordinate number of delays and
cancellations due to mechanical issues.  Are there truly that many mechanical
issues on this line or is there another issue that is really going on and using
mechanical issues as an excuse?  I understand having a bad day or two - it
happens.  However the delays and cancellations have become more commonplace.
Just frustrated and venting.

reddit title: Will the Quincy Center Escalator ever be fixed?
reddit body:
So I've seen this at not only Quincy center but at many other T Stations but do
they not even bother to look into fixing escalators anymore? For crying out loud
the Quincy center escalator has been closed off since late October and there
haven't been actively working on it since like November and it hurts the foot
traffic since you have to either fight your way down the stairs or up the
stairs, now I've gotten used to it because I'm there so often but it's still
rather annoying that they've done nothing to the escalator
